content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
This is a comprehensive task. Let me break it down:

1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Pick the best new idea
3. Implement it as a new PopeBot skill in the sandbox (.pi/skills/)
4. Write and execute a test to prove it works
5. Use send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com with a progress report

Let me start by exploring what's already in the existing repositories and skills to understand the architecture, then scan the external repos for ideas.

First, let me check what skills already exist and understand the pattern:

content.text: I'll systematically scan the three repositories, identify the best new idea, implement it as a skill, test it, and email you a progress report. Let me start by exploring the existing architecture and then scan the external repositories.

content.thinking: Now let me scan the three GitHub repositories to find new ideas. I'll clone them temporarily to examine their structure.

<tool_call>
<function=bash>
<parameter=command>
cd /job/tmp && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw.git openclaw-scan 2>&1 | head -20
</parameter>
</function>
</tool_call>
